alert.note: Alert for Morehouse (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 24 at 5:32PM CDT until March 24 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR ASHLEY COUNTY IN SOUTHEASTERN ARKANSAS AND MOREHOUSE PARISHES... At 532 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fountain Hill to near Crossett to 10 miles south of Huttig, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... North Crossett, Fountain Hill and Old Milo around 535 PM CDT. Hamburg and Beekman around 545 PM CDT. Snyder around 555 PM CDT. Berlin around 600 PM CDT. Montrose around 605 PM CDT. Parkdale around 610 PM CDT. Portland around 620 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Bonita and Blanchton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern Arkansas...and northeastern Louisiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
